body_html:
1. Used this code code,
  2. Coco Models for Inference: faster_rcnn_nas
  3. I ran in AWS using AWS EC2, type p2.xlarge, with Tesla K80,
  4. I chose a Linux instance for Deep Learning,
  5. Tensorflow GPU version: 1.8.0 and 1.9 rc
  6. Java 8

The process reserve the whole memory but the actual utilization is under 40% - 50%. I used nvidia-smi queries for monitoring the GPU.
body_text:
Used this code code,
Coco Models  for Inference: faster_rcnn_nas
I ran in AWS using AWS EC2, type p2.xlarge, with Tesla K80,
I chose a Linux instance for Deep Learning,
Tensorflow GPU version: 1.8.0 and 1.9 rc
Java 8

The process reserve the whole memory but the actual utilization is under 40% - 50%. I used nvidia-smi queries for monitoring the GPU.
body:
1) Used this code [code](https://github.com/tensorflow/models/tree/master/samples/languages/java/object_detection),
2) Coco [Models ](https://github.com/tensorflow/models/blob/master/research/object_detection/g3doc/detection_model_zoo.md) for Inference: faster_rcnn_nas
2) I ran in AWS using AWS EC2, type p2.xlarge, with Tesla K80,
3) I chose a Linux instance for Deep Learning,
4) Tensorflow GPU version: 1.8.0 and 1.9 rc
5) Java 8

 The process reserve the whole memory but the actual utilization is under 40% - 50%. I used [nvidia-smi queries](http://nvidia.custhelp.com/app/answers/detail/a_id/3751/~/useful-nvidia-smi-queries) for monitoring the GPU.
